page.title: 01The Teign Estuary Village
page.content: The 12km rectangle of 02880072 includes the steep southrrn slope of little Haldon Hills (Permian sandstone capped by cretaceous greensand with upper Devonian whiteway slates at lower levels) a ridge of basalt nd tuff trending north east from near wear farm four kilometers of the teign estuary (almost dries out to mudflats at low water springs) and an area in the north west of more gently sloping and wooded country. Ground levels range from +220m to sea level.Nestling on this south facing slope is the large village of Bishopsteignton with a population ca2000 divided between those who work here, those who live here and commute to work in larger centres (Teignmouth, Newton Abbot and Exeter) and those who have retired here. In victorian times elderly people built large houses in the
